label: Target Mapping
description: Maps protein targets to biological systems, assays, and metrics for sweet taste receptor research.

defaultInputs.name: Target/Protein Input
defaultInputs.tooltip: Optional input port carrying protein names or biological descriptions from previous steps.

defaultOutputs.name: Biological System
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Description of the biological system and expression context (e.g. "Human sweet taste receptor (GPCR), heterodimerized with TAS1R3...").

defaultOutputs.name: Desired Modulation
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Required modulation type (e.g. "Agonism or partial agonism", "Positive modulation / co-agonism").

defaultOutputs.name: Corresponding Assay
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Specific assay method used to measure the target activity (e.g. "Cell-based calcium flux assay").

defaultOutputs.name: Metric Used
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Measurement unit or metric for the assay result (e.g. "EC₅₀, Emax", "EC₅₀ shift, Emax modulation").

defaultOutputs.name: Rationale
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Scientific rationale explaining target relevance to sweet taste perception.

defaultOutputs.name: Crystallized Structure Available?
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Indicates if a crystallized structure is available with PDB IDs (e.g. "Yes (PDB: 9NOW, 9NOS..)").

defaultOutputs.name: ChEMBL ID
defaultOutputs.tooltip: ChEMBL database identifier for the target (e.g. "CHEMBL2363059").

defaultOutputs.name: PDBs
defaultOutputs.tooltip: URL to the first PDB structure file.
URL to the second PDB structure file.
URL to the third PDB structure file.

configSchema.label: Target Input
configSchema.placeholder: Enter target name or biological effect (e.g., TAS1R2, sweet taste receptor...)
configSchema.tooltip: Use this when you want to type a target or biological effect manually instead of wiring it from another node.

mappingTable.biological_system: Human sweet taste receptor (GPCR), heterodimerized with TAS1R3 in the VFT domain; expressed in taste receptor cells and heterologous systems (e.g., HEK293)
mappingTable.desired_modulation: Agonism or partial agonism (sweet perception activation)
mappingTable.corresponding_assay: Cell-based calcium flux assay (co-expression of TAS1R2/TAS1R3 with Gα16 or Gαgustducin); alternatively cAMP or IP₃ reporter assays
mappingTable.rationale: TAS1R2 contains the primary orthosteric binding determinants for many sweet ligands; agonist-induced activation correlates with perceived sweetness intensity

mappingTable.biological_system: Human sweet taste receptor co-receptor; obligate heterodimer partner of TAS1R2
mappingTable.desired_modulation: Positive modulation / co-agonism; structural stabilization of active heterodimer
mappingTable.corresponding_assay: Same calcium flux or reporter assay as above; optional mutagenesis-assisted functional assays
mappingTable.metric_used: EC₅₀ shift, Emax modulation, Δresponse vs TAS1R2 alone
mappingTable.rationale: TAS1R3 is required for receptor assembly, signaling competence, and ligand-dependent conformational change; modulation enhances or enables TAS1R2-driven activation
